Activates or deactivates the ajax mode.
Getter for the current value for the requested key.
docblock.long-description:
Setting hierarchy: - Ajax setting (if Mode is on) - Instance setting - THEWPSETTING (if Xiphe\THEMASTER\core\THEWPSETTINGS exists) - config.php setting (if exists) - default.

If the requested key is not existent on one layer the next one will be used.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Eliminates the instance setting from hierarchy.

docblock.description: Changes a global configuration.

tag.description: Eliminates the instance setting from hierarchy.

property.name: $doubleAttrs
property.default: array('input' => array('id', 'name'), 'checkbox' => array('id', 'name'), 'select' => array('id', 'name'), 'pw' => array('id', 'name'), 'textarea' => array('id', 'name'), 'hidden' => array('id', 'name'), 'action' => array('id', 'name'), 'img' => array('src', 'alt', '%callback' => array('Xiphe\HTML\core\Generator', 'magicAlt')))

docblock.description: If Tag is in Array the specified arguments will be copyed.
docblock.long-description: If the %callback key is callable if will be called after the attributes are copied.

property.name: $defaultAttributes
property.default: array('link' => array('rel' => 'stylesheet', 'type' => 'text/css', 'media' => 'all'), 'css' => array('rel' => 'stylesheet', 'type' => 'text/css', 'media' => 'all'), 'less' => array('rel' => 'stylesheet/less', 'type' => 'text/css', 'media' => 'all'), 'style' => array('rel' => 'stylesheet', 'type' => 'text/css', 'media' => 'all'), 'script' => array('type' => 'text/javascript'), 'form' => array('method' => 'post'), 'input' => array('type' => 'text'), 'checkbox' => array('type' => 'checkbox'), 'pw' => array('type' => 'password'), 'hidden' => array('type' => 'hidden', 'name' => 'action'), 'zw' => array('class' => 'zerowrap'), 'favicon' => array('rel' => 'shortcut icon', 'type' => 'image/ico'), 'clear' => array('class' => 'clear'), 'dclear' => array('class' => 'clear'), 'utf8' => array('http-equiv' => 'Content-Type', 'content' => 'text/html; charset=utf-8'), 'rederect' => array('http-equiv' => 'refresh'), 'viewport' => array('name' => 'viewport', 'content' => 'width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0'), 'appleicon' => array('rel' => 'apple-touch-icon'), 'action' => array('type' => 'hidden', 'name' => 'action'), 'description' => array('name' => 'description'))

tag.name: var
tag.description: Either a string or an array containing a callback function to determine if a line is "junk" or not.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The first sequence to compare against.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of characters that are considered junk from the second sequence. Characters are the array key.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of indices that do not contain junk elements.

docblock.description: The constructor.
docblock.long-description: With the sequences being passed, they'll be set for the sequence matcher and it will perform a basic cleanup & calculate junk elements.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array containing the lines to compare against.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array containing the lines to compare.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Either an array or string that references a callback function (if there is one) to determine 'junk' characters.

docblock.description: Set the first and second sequences to use with the sequence matcher.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array containing the lines to compare against.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A string or array containing the lines to compare.

docblock.description: Set the first sequence ($a) and reset any internal caches to indicate that when calling the calculation methods, we need to recalculate them.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sequence to set as the first sequence.

docblock.description: Set the second sequence ($b) and reset any internal caches to indicate that when calling the calculation methods, we need to recalculate them.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The sequence to set as the second sequence.

docblock.description: Generate the internal arrays containing the list of junk and non-junk characters for the second ($b) sequence.
Checks if a particular character is in the junk dictionary for the list of junk characters.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $b True if the character is considered junk. False if not.

docblock.description: Find the longest matching block in the two sequences, as defined by the lower and upper constraints for each sequence.
docblock.long-description:
(for the first sequence, $alo - $ahi and for the second sequence, $blo - $bhi)

Essentially, of all of the maximal matching blocks, return the one that startest earliest in $a, and all of those maximal matching blocks that start earliest in $a, return the one that starts earliest in $b.

If the junk callback is defined, do the above but with the restriction that the junk element appears in the block. Extend it as far as possible by matching only junk elements in both $a and $b.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The lower constraint for the first sequence.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The upper constraint for the first sequence.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The lower constraint for the second sequence.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The upper constraint for the second sequence.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array containing the longest match that includes the starting position in $a, start in $b and the length/size.

docblock.description: Check if the two lines at the given indexes are different or not.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Line number to check against in a.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Line number to check against in b.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the lines are different and false if not.

docblock.description: Return a nested set of arrays for all of the matching sub-sequences in the strings $a and $b.
docblock.long-description: Each block contains the lower constraint of the block in $a, the lower constraint of the block in $b and finally the number of lines that the block continues for.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Nested array of the matching blocks, as described by the function.

docblock.description: Return a list of all of the opcodes for the differences between the two strings.
docblock.long-description:
The nested array returned contains an array describing the opcode which includes: 0 - The type of tag (as described below) for the opcode. 1 - The beginning line in the first sequence. 2 - The end line in the first sequence. 3 - The beginning line in the second sequence. 4 - The end line in the second sequence.

The different types of tags include: replace - The string from $i1 to $i2 in $a should be replaced by the string in $b from $j1 to $j2. delete - The string in $a from $i1 to $j2 should be deleted. insert - The string in $b from $j1 to $j2 should be inserted at $i1 in $a. equal - The two strings with the specified ranges are equal.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array of the opcodes describing the differences between the strings.

docblock.description: Return a series of nested arrays containing different groups of generated opcodes for the differences between the strings with up to $context lines of surrounding content.
docblock.long-description: Essentially what happens here is any big equal blocks of strings are stripped out, the smaller subsets of changes are then arranged in to their groups. This means that the sequence matcher and diffs do not need to include the full content of the different files but can still provide context as to where the changes are.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of lines of context to provide around the groups.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Nested array of all of the grouped opcodes.

docblock.description: Return a measure of the similarity between the two sequences.
docblock.long-description:
This will be a float value between 0 and 1.

Out of all of the ratio calculation functions, this is the most expensive to call if getMatchingBlocks or getOpCodes is yet to be called. The other calculation methods (quickRatio and realquickRatio) can be used to perform quicker calculations but may be less accurate.

The ratio is calculated as (2 * number of matches) / total number of elements in both sequences.

docblock.description: Helper function to calculate the number of matches for Ratio().

tag.name: param
tag.description: The running total for the number of matches.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array containing the matching block triple to add to the running total.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The new running total for the number of matches.

docblock.description: Quickly return an upper bound ratio for the similarity of the strings.
docblock.long-description: This is quicker to compute than Ratio().

docblock.description: Return an upper bound ratio really quickly for the similarity of the strings.
docblock.long-description: This is quicker to compute than Ratio() and quickRatio().

docblock.description: Helper function for calculating the ratio to measure similarity for the strings.
docblock.long-description: The ratio is defined as being 2 * (number of matches / total length)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of matches in the two strings.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The length of the two strings.

docblock.description: Helper function that provides the ability to return the value for a key in an array of it exists, or if it doesn't then return a default value.
docblock.long-description: Essentially cleaner than doing a series of if(isset()) {} else {} calls.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key to check that exists.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to return as the default value if the key doesn't exist.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value from the array if the key exists or otherwise the default.

docblock.description: Sort an array by the nested arrays it contains.
docblock.long-description: Helper function for getMatchingBlocks

tag.name: return
tag.description: -1, 0 or 1, as expected by the usort function.

docblock.description: Diff
docblock.long-description:
A comprehensive library for generating differences between two strings in multiple formats (unified, side by side HTML etc)

PHP version 5

Copyright (c) 2009 Chris Boulton chris.boulton@interspire.com

All rights reserved.

Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

tag.name: var
tag.description: The "old" sequence to use as the basis for the comparison.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The "new" sequence to generate the changes for.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array containing the generated opcodes for the differences between the two items.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Associative array of the default options available for the diff class and their default value.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Array of the options that have been applied for generating the diff.

docblock.description: The constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array containing the lines of the first string to compare.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array containing the lines for the second string to compare.

docblock.description: Render a diff using the supplied rendering class and return it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An instance of the rendering object to use for generating the diff.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The generated diff. Exact return value depends on the rendered.

docblock.description: Get a range of lines from $start to $end from the first comparison string and return them as an array.
docblock.long-description: If no values are supplied, the entire string is returned. It's also possible to specify just one line to return only that line.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ending number. If not supplied, only the item in $start will be returned.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array of all of the lines between the specified range.

docblock.description: Get a range of lines from $start to $end from the second comparison string and return them as an array.
docblock.long-description: If no values are supplied, the entire string is returned. It's also possible to specify just one line to return only that line.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ending number. If not supplied, only the item in $start will be returned.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array of all of the lines between the specified range.

docblock.description: Generate a list of the compiled and grouped opcodes for the differences between the two strings.
docblock.long-description: Generally called by the renderer, this class instantiates the sequence matcher and performs the actual diff generation and return an array of the opcodes for it. Once generated, the results are cached in the diff class instance.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Array of the grouped opcodes for the generated diff.
